meanings.sent1: The insignificancy of the small pebble was clear next to the giant boulder.
meanings.sent2: She felt the insignificancy of her role in the play, but she still gave it her all.
meanings.sent3: The insignificancy of the tiny ant trying to move the huge crumb made everyone chuckle.
meanings.sent4: In the grand scheme of the universe, our problems seem like mere insignificancies.
meanings.sent5: The insignificancy of the single raindrop in the storm was a reminder of nature's power.

meanings.definition: The state of being unimportant or trivial.
meanings.sent1: He dismissed her opinion with such insignificancy that it hurt her feelings.
meanings.sent2: The insignificancy of the old toy to the child was evident as they chose a new one.
meanings.sent3: The insignificancy of the broken pencil led to a hilarious misunderstanding in class.
meanings.sent4: The insignificancy of the pebble skipping across the lake was a moment of pure joy.
meanings.sent5: The insignificancy of the lost button caused a whole outfit to look incomplete.
